Minecraft has long offered the ability to customize your character’s appearance in-game. While skins are sometimes offered for a fee in the other Minecraft versions, they are still free in the Java version. Still, changing your skin is a bit complex.
In the future it is planned to integrate said function into the Minecraft launcher. Until then, unfortunately, you still have to go through the browser. But today we will show you how this can be done quickly and easily!

1st step

Visit Mojang’s official Minecraft site and log in using your Minecraft Launcher credentials. It is important that you are there with your e-mail address and your password. Unlike Minecraft’s launcher, this is log in with the Minecraft usernames not allowed here.

The login window on the Minecraft site

2nd step

After you successfully logged in have, clicks you now on the Item “Menu”which you can find on the top right of the page under your email.

After the click there should be a relatively large one Open pop-up menuin which you also right on the Click on the “Profile” menu item.

3rd step

Now you should are on your Mojang Minecraft profile. Here you will find a list with your personal data such as profile name, e-mail, date of birth or password on the right-hand side. On the left you find one another menu with said Menu item “Skin”.

Just click where the red arrow is pointing!

4th step

Now you are in the “Change your skin” menu, in which you first of all change your type of character can choose. you have them selection between Classic and Slim. While the Classic skin is slightly wider, the Slim skin (as the name suggests) is a slightly narrower version of the Minecraft character.
Important: There are different resolutions of the skin images. For example, if you want a slim skin, you have to search for it explicitly.

We choose the classic version of the skin here!

Now all you have to do is upload your skin. Minecraft skins have a specific image format. in the Internet you will find plenty different skins to download. Just google it. In addition, there are also skin editors on many pages, in which you can pixel your personal skin. Of course, this requires some artistic skill!

Simply click on “Choose file” to upload your skin.

After you’ve selected it, all you have to do is open it “upload” click and you have a new character appearance in the game.

Thank you for reading this article! If you want to know what the differences are between Minecraft Java and Windows 10 Edition, then we have an article for you here too!
